geosdf_prompts.description: A right triangle ABC where angle C is 90 degrees, side AC = 3 cm, side BC = 4 cm, and the hypotenuse AB = 5 cm. Label all sides with their lengths and mark the right angle with a small square.
An isosceles triangle PQR where PQ = PR = 6 cm, and the base QR = 4 cm. The vertex angle at P is 40 degrees. Label all sides and the vertex angle.
An equilateral triangle XYZ with each side measuring 5 cm. All interior angles are 60 degrees. Label each vertex and show one angle measurement.
Two horizontal parallel lines L1 and L2 cut by a transversal line T at a 65 degree angle. Label the corresponding angles and alternate interior angles.
A circle with center O and radius 4 cm. Point P is outside the circle at distance 8 cm from O. Draw two tangent lines from P to the circle, touching at points A and B.
A circle with an inscribed equilateral triangle ABC. The circle has center O and the triangle vertices touch the circumference. Label the center and all vertices.
A line segment AB of length 8 cm with its perpendicular bisector line M passing through the midpoint. Mark the midpoint and show the 90 degree angle.
An angle AOB of 70 degrees with its angle bisector OC. Label the original angle and show that each half is 35 degrees.
A rectangle ABCD with length 6 cm and width 4 cm. Draw both diagonals AC and BD intersecting at point E. Label all vertices and the intersection point.
A rhombus PQRS with diagonals PR = 10 cm and QS = 6 cm intersecting at right angles at point O. Label all vertices and show the perpendicular intersection.
An isosceles trapezoid ABCD with parallel sides AB = 10 cm (top) and CD = 16 cm (bottom). The non-parallel sides are each 5 cm. Label all measurements.
Two similar triangles: triangle ABC with sides 3, 4, 5 cm and triangle DEF with sides 6, 8, 10 cm. Position them side by side to show the 1:2 ratio.
A circle with center O, diameter AB = 10 cm, and a chord CD of length 6 cm parallel to AB. Show the perpendicular distance from O to chord CD.
A triangle ABC with exterior angle ACD at vertex C. The interior angles at A and B are 50 and 60 degrees respectively. Show that exterior angle ACD = 110 degrees.
A quadrilateral ABCD with angles: A = 80 degrees, B = 100 degrees, C = 70 degrees, D = 110 degrees. Label all four angles to show they sum to 360 degrees.
A scalene triangle ABC with altitude h drawn from vertex A perpendicular to base BC, meeting at point D. Label the altitude and show the right angle at D.
A triangle ABC with all three medians drawn, intersecting at centroid G. Label the midpoints of each side as D, E, F and show the centroid.
A right triangle with legs a = 3 and b = 4, hypotenuse c = 5. Draw squares on each side to visually demonstrate a² + b² = c² (9 + 16 = 25).
Two concentric circles with center O. Inner circle has radius 3 cm, outer circle has radius 5 cm. Shade the annular region between them.
A regular hexagon ABCDEF inscribed in a circle with center O. Draw all diagonals from vertex A and label each vertex. Show one interior angle of 120 degrees.

ccj_prompts.description: A Venn diagram showing two overlapping sets: Set A contains {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} and Set B contains {4, 5, 6, 7, 8}. The intersection contains {4, 5}. Label each region with its elements.
A Venn diagram with three overlapping circles representing Sets A, B, and C. Label each of the 7 distinct regions (A only, B only, C only, A∩B, B∩C, A∩C, A∩B∩C).
A flowchart for deciding whether to bring an umbrella: Start → Check weather forecast → Diamond decision 'Rain predicted?' → Yes: Bring umbrella → End, No: Don't bring umbrella → End.

A flowchart for user login: Start → Enter credentials → Validate → Decision 'Valid?' → Yes: Grant access → End, No: Show error → Retry counter → Decision 'Attempts < 3?' → Yes: loop back, No: Lock account → End.
A visual representation of the arithmetic sequence 2, 5, 8, 11, 14 showing each term as a row of dots, with arrows indicating the common difference of +3 between terms.
A visual representation of the geometric sequence 2, 6, 18, 54 using progressively larger squares, with multiplication arrows showing ×3 between each term.
A number line from -5 to 5 with all integers marked. Highlight the positions of -3, 0, and 4 with colored dots and labels.
A number line from 0 to 2 showing the positions of 1/4, 1/2, 3/4, 1, 5/4, 3/2, 7/4, and 2. Each fraction should be labeled above its position.
A bar chart showing favorite fruits: Apples (15), Bananas (12), Oranges (8), Grapes (10). Use different colors for each bar with a legend and axis labels.
A pie chart showing monthly budget allocation: Housing 35%, Food 20%, Transportation 15%, Entertainment 10%, Savings 20%. Label each slice with category and percentage.
A probability tree diagram for flipping a coin twice. Show all branches: First flip (H/T, 0.5 each) → Second flip (H/T, 0.5 each) → Four outcomes (HH, HT, TH, TT) with probabilities.
A tree diagram showing outfit combinations: 3 shirts (Red, Blue, Green) × 2 pants (Jeans, Khakis) = 6 total combinations. List all combinations at the end branches.
A coordinate plane with x and y axes from -5 to 5. Plot and label the points A(2,3), B(-1,4), C(-3,-2), D(4,-1), and the origin O(0,0).
A coordinate plane showing the line y = 2x + 1. Plot at least 3 points on the line: (-1,-1), (0,1), (1,3), (2,5). Label the y-intercept and show the slope.
A graph of the parabola y = x² on a coordinate plane. Show the vertex at (0,0), axis of symmetry, and plot points at x = -2, -1, 0, 1, 2.
A concept map for fractions with central node 'Fractions' connected to: Types (proper, improper, mixed), Operations (add, subtract, multiply, divide), Equivalence, and Decimals.
A horizontal timeline from 1900 to 2000 with major events: 1914 (WWI starts), 1945 (WWII ends), 1969 (Moon landing), 1989 (Berlin Wall falls). Use evenly spaced markers.
A place value chart showing the number 4,572.38 with columns for thousands, hundreds, tens, ones, decimal point, tenths, hundredths. Each digit in its correct column.
A bar model showing the fraction 3/4: a rectangle divided into 4 equal parts with 3 parts shaded. Label the shaded portion as 3/4 and unshaded as 1/4.
A visual array showing 4 × 5 = 20 using a grid of 4 rows and 5 columns of dots. Label the dimensions and total count.

edge_case_prompts.description: A diagram showing the relationship between area formulas: a square, rectangle, triangle, and circle, each with their area formula labeled inside.
A reference diagram showing all angle types: acute (45°), right (90°), obtuse (120°), straight (180°), reflex (270°), arranged in a grid with labels.

A hierarchy diagram showing polygon classification: Polygons → Triangles/Quadrilaterals/Pentagons/Hexagons, with Quadrilaterals further divided into parallelograms, rectangles, squares, rhombi, trapezoids.
A coordinate plane showing triangle ABC and its reflection A'B'C' across the y-axis. Original triangle at (1,1), (3,1), (2,3) and reflected at (-1,1), (-3,1), (-2,3).
A unit circle on a coordinate plane showing all four quadrants. Mark the angles 0°, 90°, 180°, 270°, 360° and their radian equivalents (0, π/2, π, 3π/2, 2π).
